title: Scandi Girls are All About These 6 Minimalist Coat Trends This Winter
excerpt: From sleek leather coats to elegant collarless jackets, these 6 minimalist coat trends are Scandi girl-approved. Shop the full edit, now.
text: For the past couple of days, I've been planning my outfits for Copenhagen Fashion Week, mimicking the cool, Danish girls who have that effortless style I can't seem to master. While I can't copy their secret sauce, I can steal their sartorial inspiration, opting to take their approach to winter outerwear.When it comes to coat trends, Scandinavians have practically mastered the art of minimalist dressing. Think sleek, timeless pieces that slot seamlessly into any wardrobe and stay relevant for years. Whether it’s a perfectly tailored leather trench or a cozy, oversized wool coat, these styles are built to last—both in quality and cool factor. Classic colors like deep neutrals, rich blacks, and soft browns are a signature of the Scandinavian aesthetic, making every piece feel effortlessly chic.Below, scroll through and see all of the chic, minimalist coat trends the Scandi style set is wearing this winter. Trust me, all of these are already sitting in my cart in anticipation of the surge of cool girl street style we'll see in just a few weeks time.Funnel Neck CoatsPhoebe Philo's impact on trends can't be denied, even years after dominating the minds of industry insiders. Last fall, the British designer released several swaddled, incredibly chic high-neck coats under her namesake label and, naturally, fashion listened. The trend has picked up steam since and, of course, is beloved by all minimalist Scandis aiming to nail that effortless look. Mango Double-Breasted Wool Coat Phoebe Philo Trench Coat with Attachable Scarf Marant Etoile Levina Wool-Blend Coat & Other Stories Funnel-Collar Wool Coat Banana Republic Oversized Italian Twill Trench Coat Fur CoatsLiving in the Nordics means mastering the art of dressing chic in sub-zero temps. Enter the fur coat: a staple for those who want to brave the chill without sacrificing style. Whether vintage or faux, it's the perfect way to wrap yourself in warmth while making a serious fashion statement. Zara Faux Fur Long Coat Limited Edition Nour Hammour Daphne Scarf-Detailed Shearling Coat Agolde Brown Shoreditch Ski Club Edition Ebony Faux-Fur Coat Scarf CoatsIn case you’ve been living under a rock, yes, we’re still basking in the era of the viral Toteme scarf coat. Each winter, the Scandinavian brand’s signature contrast-stitch silhouette dominates our feeds, and this season is no exception. After last year’s meteoric rise across TikTok (RIP!), other brands have caught on, weaving their own chic, yet functional scarf details into outerwear designs. Toteme Embroidered Scarf Jacket Sandro Paris Oversized Wool Coat Toteme Embroidered Scarf Coat La Marque Twila Double Face Coat Nicholas Candice Scarf Double Wool Coat Structured Coats Zara Wool Blend Double Breasted Coat Zw Collection Aritzia Babaton The Slouch Coat Aritzia Wilfred Cecile Coat Leather CoatsLeather coats are having a major moment, and frankly, we’re here for it. From sleek, buttery soft trenches to slouchy, oversized silhouettes, these elegant pieces are a masterclass in cool outerwear. This season, the leather coat is no longer just for edgy nights out in all black—Scandis are opting to add neutral alts into their wardrobe instead of the traditional black options. Aritzia Babaton New Tabloid Trench Coat Eaves Formosa Leather Coat Karen Millen High Shine Leather Clean Trench Coat Toteme Tan Belted Long Leather Coat Bardot Faux Leather Trench Coat Collarless CoatsJust like last year's lady jacket trend, collarless coats are the new definition of understated elegance. With their clean lines and minimalist appeal, these coats offer a refined, polished look that feels both timeless and modern when layered over casual pieces like white t-shirts or simple jeans. The Row Prisheella Cashmere Coat Jacquemus Le Manteau Ovalo Single-Breasted Coat KarenMillen Premium Italian Manteco Wool Collarless Belted Tailored Maxi Coat Ana Escalante is an award-winning journalist and Gen Z editor whose work ranges from dissecting size inclusivity at fashion week to discussing how American Girl Doll meme accounts are the the answer to society's collective spiral. She's covered it all: Copenhagen Fashion Week, Roe v. Wade frontline protests, and the re-branding of jorts, or, jean shorts for the uninitiated. At Who What Wear, Ana crafts sharp, irreverent features that speak to a digital-first generation, bringing her signature wit and unapologetic tone to long-form fashion and beauty content. If it’s smart, snarky, and a little unexpected, you'll probably find her name on it.
html:
For the past couple of days, I've been planning my outfits for Copenhagen Fashion Week, mimicking the cool, Danish girls who have that effortless style I can't seem to master. While I can't copy their secret sauce, I can steal their sartorial inspiration, opting to take their approach to winter outerwear.

When it comes to coat trends, Scandinavians have practically mastered the art of minimalist dressing. Think sleek, timeless pieces that slot seamlessly into any wardrobe and stay relevant for years. Whether it’s a perfectly tailored leather trench or a cozy, oversized wool coat, these styles are built to last—both in quality and cool factor. Classic colors like deep neutrals, rich blacks, and soft browns are a signature of the Scandinavian aesthetic, making every piece feel effortlessly chic.

Below, scroll through and see all of the chic, minimalist coat trends the Scandi style set is wearing this winter. Trust me, all of these are already sitting in my cart in anticipation of the surge of cool girl street style we'll see in just a few weeks time.

Funnel Neck Coats

Phoebe Philo's impact on trends can't be denied, even years after dominating the minds of industry insiders. Last fall, the British designer released several swaddled, incredibly chic high-neck coats under her namesake label and, naturally, fashion listened. The trend has picked up steam since and, of course, is beloved by all minimalist Scandis aiming to nail that effortless look.

Mango

Double-Breasted Wool Coat

Phoebe Philo

Trench Coat with Attachable Scarf

Marant Etoile

Levina Wool-Blend Coat

& Other Stories

Funnel-Collar Wool Coat

Banana Republic

Oversized Italian Twill Trench Coat

Fur Coats

Living in the Nordics means mastering the art of dressing chic in sub-zero temps. Enter the fur coat: a staple for those who want to brave the chill without sacrificing style. Whether vintage or faux, it's the perfect way to wrap yourself in warmth while making a serious fashion statement.

Zara

Faux Fur Long Coat Limited Edition

Nour Hammour

Daphne Scarf-Detailed Shearling Coat

Agolde

Brown Shoreditch Ski Club Edition Ebony Faux-Fur Coat

Scarf Coats

In case you’ve been living under a rock, yes, we’re still basking in the era of the viral Toteme scarf coat. Each winter, the Scandinavian brand’s signature contrast-stitch silhouette dominates our feeds, and this season is no exception. After last year’s meteoric rise across TikTok (RIP!), other brands have caught on, weaving their own chic, yet functional scarf details into outerwear designs.

Toteme

Embroidered Scarf Jacket

Sandro Paris

Oversized Wool Coat

Toteme

Embroidered Scarf Coat

La Marque

Twila Double Face Coat

Nicholas

Candice Scarf Double Wool Coat

Structured Coats

Zara

Wool Blend Double Breasted Coat Zw Collection

Aritzia

Babaton The Slouch Coat

Aritzia

Wilfred Cecile Coat

Leather Coats

Leather coats are having a major moment, and frankly, we’re here for it. From sleek, buttery soft trenches to slouchy, oversized silhouettes, these elegant pieces are a masterclass in cool outerwear. This season, the leather coat is no longer just for edgy nights out in all black—Scandis are opting to add neutral alts into their wardrobe instead of the traditional black options.

Aritzia

Babaton New Tabloid Trench Coat

Eaves

Formosa Leather Coat

Karen Millen

High Shine Leather Clean Trench Coat

Toteme

Tan Belted Long Leather Coat

Bardot

Faux Leather Trench Coat

Collarless Coats

Just like last year's lady jacket trend, collarless coats are the new definition of understated elegance. With their clean lines and minimalist appeal, these coats offer a refined, polished look that feels both timeless and modern when layered over casual pieces like white t-shirts or simple jeans.

The Row

Prisheella Cashmere Coat

Jacquemus

Le Manteau Ovalo Single-Breasted Coat

KarenMillen

Premium Italian Manteco Wool Collarless Belted Tailored Maxi Coat

Ana Escalante is an award-winning journalist and Gen Z editor whose work ranges from dissecting size inclusivity at fashion week to discussing how American Girl Doll meme accounts are the the answer to society's collective spiral. She's covered it all: Copenhagen Fashion Week, Roe v. Wade frontline protests, and the re-branding of jorts, or, jean shorts for the uninitiated. At Who What Wear, Ana crafts sharp, irreverent features that speak to a digital-first generation, bringing her signature wit and unapologetic tone to long-form fashion and beauty content. If it’s smart, snarky, and a little unexpected, you'll probably find her name on it.
